p: When performing the sensitivity analysis to assess the weight of each individual study on the combined frequency through the removal of individual studies, there was no study that significantly affected the combined frequency ( S4 Table). In addition, subgroup analyses were performed. For the majority of the results, high heterogeneity was observed (I 2>75%). Low heterogeneity was found only in the subgroup of clinical signs (vomit, diarrhea and dermatological signs; I 2 = 0.0). It should be emphasized that these results were expected, given that in observational epidemiological studies there is a considerable occurrence of diversity due to the study design, detection methodology and epidemiological variations.
